A custom model, developed on the basis of the AK-74M by the Las Vegas-based American company Rifle Dynamics utilizting advanced synthetic materials derived from artefacts. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone and is built with an unprecedented level of precision and care. It designed for ISG special units for extremely accurate automatic fire.
 The ISG issue RD-74N features a gas blowback system derived from the 'spike' artefact, which allows for an incredibly high cycle time with minimal barrel movement

A model developed by Kalashnikov USA on the basis of the Komrad 12 semi-automatic rifle for hunting and protecting members of the ISG research teams from mutants. The weapon has both a dovetail mount and a Picatinny bar for use with various types of sights. This model has a new type of trigger mechanism which allows for two round bursts.
 Not originally intended to be part of ISG's equipment, the saiga12s was hastily comissioned following mission data that highlighted the extreme ammo expendature on local wildlife.

A custom model, developed on the basis of the AKSU by the Las Vegas-based American company Rifle Dynamics. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone and is built with an unprecedented level of precision and care. It is often used by ISG special units.
 The RD-74u is one of the earliest attempts to integrate artefact and firearms technology, boasting an absolutely insane fire rate for a rile calbier weapon. Often issued as a holdout weapon for ISG marksman or deep cover units.

Based on the Ak 5 or Automatkarbin 5 ("automatic carbine 5"), the Swedish version of the FN FNC assault rifle, the ISG issue AK5C was engineered for extreme durability. Designed to function flawlessly even if immersed in highly corrosive anomalous materials or rapdily heated and cooled, care was taken to even ensure the rifle was non-conductive.
 A breakthrough was made when american scientists working on temporal anomalies discovered a way to "fix" objects in time, making them functionally immutable.
